meanings.definition: To run at a steady, gentle pace.
meanings.sent1: She jogged around the park every morning.
meanings.sent2: He jogged slowly to keep his heart healthy.
meanings.sent3: The turtle jogged past the hare in the race.
meanings.sent4: The river jogged along the valley, never rushing.
meanings.sent5: The idea of jogging through the forest filled her with joy.

meanings.sent1: The loose wheel jogged as the car moved.
meanings.sent2: The sudden stop jogged the passengers in their seats.
meanings.sent3: The wind jogged the leaves on the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake jogged the dishes in the cupboard.
meanings.sent5: The boat jogged gently on the calm water of the lake.

meanings.sent1: The familiar smell jogged his memory of childhood.
meanings.sent2: The old song jogged her emotions and made her cry.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the dish jogged his taste buds awake.
meanings.sent4: The photograph jogged her thoughts back to that special day.
meanings.sent5: The book jogged his imagination, inspiring new ideas.
